content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="http://mrdata.usgs.gov/laterite/laterite.xsl"?><record id="3"><agegrp>b</agegrp><dep10km>low-sulfide quartz-Au veins</dep10km><cogrd>0.12</cogrd><coregrd>0.1</coregrd><cotogrd>0.1</cotogrd><comments>In June 2003 the nickel laterite resource at Bulong comprised 150 Mt (without Ni and Co grades, because the resource of 1999 is placed) with a mineable reserve of 6.9 Mt at 1.57% Ni and 0.12% Co (non JORC compliant) (Donegan, 2006). The deposit is mined by series of small opencasts at maximum depth ~40 m. Ni content in unweathered  source ultramafic rocks is 0.2\ufffd\ufffd0.3% (Elias and others, 1981).</comments><country>Australia</country><cntrycd>AUWA</cntrycd><deparea>31</deparea><deplength>20</deplength><depshape>discontinuous blanket along strike of faulted source peridotite, dunite, of layered mafic-ultramafic complex</srcbedrock><startdate>1998</startdate><stprov>Western Australia</stprov><status>mining operations</status><subtype>(II) Mg silicate (oxide,
